alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Cumberland; Harnett; Johnston; Lee; Wake; Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 5:09PM EST until December 17 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Chatham, Cumberland, Harnett, Johnston, Lee, Wake and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Significant ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 503 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Areas along Crabtree Creek and Walnut Creek in Wake County are the most likely places to experience flooding. - Gauge reports as of 5 PM indicate the Crabtree Creek Greenway and the athletic fields between the creek and Aviation Parkway in Morrisville are flooded. Also, portions of the Walnut Creek Greenway in Raleigh is flooded between Trailwood Drive and Sunnybrook Drive. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Durham, Fayetteville, Cary, Knightdale, Goldsboro, Sanford, Smithfield, Mount Olive, Pittsboro, Lillington, Siler City, Wake Forest, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Clayton, Dunn, Zebulon, Angier and Benson.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. If driving, use caution and slow down to avoid hydroplaning. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Chatham; Cumberland; Harnett; Johnston; Lee; Wake; Wayne
